description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that the RSSI data value object for
the 3G cellular interface has exceeded the range specified by the
user.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Receive Signal Strength Indicator for the cellular
connection. This value is a measurement of signal strength.
variables.name: ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GRSSI

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that the ECIO data value object for
the 3G cellular interface has exceeded the range specified by the
user.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-AOS-3G::ecioDataRangeAlarm IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GECIO s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Ec/Io for the cellular connection. This is the ratio of
received pilot energy to the total received energy. The value
is similar to signal-to-noise ratio.
variables.name: ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GECIO

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that the RSSI data value object for
the 3G cellular interface has returned to the range specified by
the user.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Receive Signal Strength Indicator for the cellular
connection. This value is a measurement of signal strength.
variables.name: ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GRSSI

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that the ECIO data value object for
the 3G cellular interface has returned to the range specified by
the user.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-AOS-3G::ecioDataRangeClear IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GECIO s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The Ec/Io for the cellular connection. This is the ratio of
received pilot energy to the total received energy. The value
is similar to signal-to-noise ratio.
variables.name: ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GECIO

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that a data value object for the 3G
cellular interface from the 3G Hardware Table has been modified
from the previous state.

event.Summary: 3G cellular interface data value object modified

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in
an agent role, has detected that the 3G modem has been reset.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting
in an agent role, has detected that the service type for the 3G
cellular interface has changed.

event.Summary: 3G cellular interface service type changed to $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-AOS-3G::serviceTypeChangeAlarm IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GServiceType s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The current Cellular Service Type for
the cellular connection.
variables.name: ADTRAN-AOS-3G::adGenAOS3GServiceType

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting
in an agent role, has detected that the connection status of the
modem has gone down from either DORMANT or a CONNECTED state.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex
